channel.title: math.MG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.MG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Bijective rigidity of uniform Roe algebras and injectivity of the comparison map
item.description: arXiv:2602.06720v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We show that, for uniformly locally finite metric spaces $X$ and $Y$ with isomorphic uniform Roe algebras $C^*_u(X)$ and $C^*_u(Y)$, the existence of a bijective coarse equivalence $f \colon X \to Y$ is equivalent to the injectivity of the $0$th comparison map appearing in the HK conjecture for coarse groupoids. We further prove that the $0$th comparison map is injective unconditionally. Moreover, if the underlying space is coarsely connected, this map is in fact split-injective.
item.dc:creator: Kostyantyn Krutoy
